paper_abstract: The fundamental difference of phase measurements from other measurements in satellite navigation is the presence of constant ambiguous component because of which the acceptable estimate quality is achieved only in the case of measurement during some time interval. In the framework of conventional relations of the least squares method, it is necessary to process matrices with large dimensions which have no pronounced banded or diagonal structure. A recurrent procedure equivalent to the least squares method in the considered problem is proposed; this procedure deals with matrices of small dimensions. The quantities characterizing the quality of the obtained estimate (precision dilution factors) are determined.
paper_title: Recurrent form of the least squares method in the problem of processing phase satellite navigation measurements
